pr_title: TES should reject unsupported verb and uri and add tests

timeline.message: TES restarts server on port change

timeline.bodyText: don't pass the exception as a string, just pass it as e
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: maybe don't create a new method. Evergreen can restart your service for you if you call requestRestart
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: Would this work without restarting all components?
timeline.author: prateek-y

replies.bodyText: No, env vars are only set once, so running components won't get it
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: So, we cannot change the port without restarting the kernel. I think we would need to disallow changing that. :(
replies.author: prateek-y

replies.bodyText: I see. I will remove the port related changes.
replies.author: youtuyy

timeline.bodyText: nit: move this out to a method. its being repeated now.
timeline.author: prateek-y

timeline.message: Handle unsupported method and uri and add tests

timeline.author: prateek-y

timeline.bodyText: I think this is warn, since customers should not do this at all. This might be indicative of a rogue process.
timeline.author: prateek-y

timeline.bodyText: lets add all verbs for sake of completeness
timeline.author: prateek-y

timeline.bodyText: let's also handle the case, when customer sends a URI with prefixed, suffixed with another string. Something like "/something" +TES_URI, TES_URI + "/something".
timeline.author: prateek-y

timeline.bodyText: wondering if we can extract all this to a private method.
timeline.author: prateek-y

timeline.bodyText: Lets send a random body with post as well.
timeline.author: prateek-y
prateek-y
